intro: Kitchingia schizophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, annual herb that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal and inland sandy regions. Kitchingia schizophylla plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
